intro: Vermeulenia papilionacea, commonly known as the yellow bellvista, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble bells. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in the understory of tropical forests. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a velvety texture. The flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects.
